pr_title: SONARJAVA-3367 use JUnit5 instead of JUnit4 annotations

timeline.message: SONARJAVA-3367 Added check for JUnit4 annotations, suggesting the corresponding JUnit5 annotation instead.
SONARJAVA-3367 Added expected test results, improved test.

timeline.bodyText: It needs to be clearly discussed and clarified at one point, but the case where the semantic is missing should never happen, we already removed this check for many rules. I believe you can also remove this one (and the corresponding test).
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

replies.bodyText: Okay, good then I'll leave it out entirely in future. My latest understanding was that it can happen for some rules and not for others - far nicer if it doesn't need to be included everywhere!
replies.author: johann-beleites-sonarsource

replies.bodyText: To clarify - do we generally still need the test with .withoutSemantic() in that case?
replies.author: johann-beleites-sonarsource

replies.bodyText: No, we don't need it anymore.
replies.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.message: Fixed a couple of code smells
